{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3341721,"name":"Daniel","username":"1515_daniel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/1515_daniel/{size}/210147_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T04:45:54.355Z","cooked":"

Hello,

We have been trying to implement Apriltags to our autonomous but are struggling a bit. We have been following the instructions on the limelight website(Robot Localization with MegaTag | Limelight Documentation), and in the limelight viewer on localhost, the shown bot position is correct. On the other hand, when we update the pose estimator and display where the code thinks the robot is, the number is wildly off and starts increasing and oscillating to reach infinity and negative infinity. We have been displaying our odometry and our estimated pose to view these values, and odometry is correct so we belive it must be the limelight. Our code can be found at GitHub - mortorqrobotics/BotterThanRevenge: 2024 Team 1515 FRC Robot Code in the limelightAuto branch. Any help would be appreciated.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T04:49:30.259Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":383,"reads":245,"readers_count":244,"score":1964.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459879,"topic_slug":"limelight-megatag-issues","display_username":"Daniel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.limelightvision.io/docs/docs-limelight/pipeline-apriltag/apriltag-robot-localization","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Robot Localization with MegaTag | Limelight Documentation","clicks":17},{"url":"https://github.com/mortorqrobotics/BotterThanRevenge","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - mortorqrobotics/BotterThanRevenge: 2024 Team 1515 FRC Robot Code","clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63120,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limelight-megatag-issues/459879/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3341783,"name":"Jason Daming","username":"jdaming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T13:00:57.137Z","cooked":"

The short answer is don’t use any examples from Limelight on this. They all vastly oversimplify the problem and to my knowledge have never actually been run on a robot. Here is a better starting point

Instead try something that takes into account all three (in my experience) of the major sources of error of the limelight megatag.

  1. Number of tags - this one is decently covered.
  2. Distance - Not using this is crazy. Go on your field and set your robot at the maximum distance that it sees a tag. The pose will likely be jumping all over the place as the tag is just a “few” pixels. Keep moving it forward till it stays fairly steady. That distance is what you should start trusting and get more trusting as it gets closer. I think the most important distance is to the closest tag but LL only gives (without using the slow json) us average so .
  3. Robot speed - This is by far the hardest to account for. The problem is getting “ground truth” and logging the right data and timing to analyze the data. A simpler less correct solution is just to only add the pose when going below a certain speed. I suggest constantly plotting the LL position and observe the megatag while driving at different speeds. Pick one reasonably steady. We could also try to increase confidence as speed goes down but I am not sure the relationship is linear. That would take significantly more testing.

The limelight 3G might improve the speed problem, but I have still not seen any actual data.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T13:00:57.137Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":199,"readers_count":198,"score":109.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":459879,"topic_slug":"limelight-megatag-issues","display_username":"Jason Daming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/6391-Ursuline-Bearbotics/2024-6391-Crescendo/blob/master/src/main/java/frc/robot/Vision/Limelight.java","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"2024-6391-Crescendo/src/main/java/frc/robot/Vision/Limelight.java at master · 6391-Ursuline-Bearbotics/2024-6391-Crescendo · GitHub","clicks":77}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18342,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-megatag-issues/459879/2","custom_user_title":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341788,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T13:22:36.685Z","cooked":"

Points 1, 2, and 3 are critical and I think the “starting point” might also include
4. checking to make sure the LL is still within the field and
5. also check that the LL isn’t too far from odometry.
6. ignore data that has the robot going at impossibly fast speeds between LL poses
7. could be the latest LL software has an ambiguity measure to check and
8. filter and keep only the tag numbers in the game.

With only a quick look at your code I couldn’t tell if you are updating odometry with the Estimated Pose result. Odometry is good only over a short range and it’s the LL that gets the robot back on track. Obviously that’s why we are trying to get the LL right even at the expense of throwing away a lot of (bad) data to get a “rare” good point to combine to get a corrected odometry.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T13:22:36.685Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":89.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459879,"topic_slug":"limelight-megatag-issues","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/limelight-megatag-issues/459879/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341805,"name":"Jason Daming","username":"jdaming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T13:54:42.394Z","cooked":"

The code I linked does account for 4 & 5. 6 seems like a fair check but I have no data how often it happens in practice. Seems like it would be filtered out by the others. Regarding number 7 I would be curious to see that software and see that data that backs it up. Number 8 is a good camera setting along with a bunch of other critical on camera settings. I find LL does a good job of describing those settings here. My addition would be to generally try to maximize your resolution (you want a few good updates not a lot of inaccurate ones). Framerate isn’t nearly as important as it is when doing a PID on yaw type control.

I am also interested in:

  1. Creating a setup with stationary always in view tags on the ceiling similar to what CTRE did for “ground truth” data.
  2. Using the accelerometer to detect “bumps” (hitting another robot or the field) and then increasing the trust on whatever tags are found after that. This is IMO the biggest sources of odometry error. Detecting when a “bump” is likely to have occurred also allows us to know when the robot pose and tag pose are less likely to line up and prevent us from dropping “good” LL data that doesn’t match bad robot pose data.
  3. Using the megatag angle to help determine confidence in poses. In general angle data should be “thrown away” due to advanced IMUs (I like the pigeon 2) being much more accurate over the relatively short frc match. I am interested in seeing if there is correlation between a “bad” angle and bad/worse pose. This might give us another quality metric by checking how close the megatag angle is to the “known good” IMU angle.
SLAB-Mr.Thomas:

Odometry is good only over a short range

This is may be true for your robot, but it not true for all others. CTRE has proven that you can get good (different teams might have different definitions of this) odometry data if you are able to increase your odometry update rate and use time synchronization.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T13:54:42.394Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":151,"readers_count":150,"score":85.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":459879,"topic_slug":"limelight-megatag-issues","display_username":"Jason Daming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://pro.docs.ctr-electronics.com/en/latest/docs/application-notes/update-frequency-impact.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Factors that Impact Odometry","clicks":10},{"url":"https://docs.limelightvision.io/docs/docs-limelight/pipeline-apriltag/apriltags#quick-start-for-frc-apriltags","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Tracking AprilTags | Limelight Documentation","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18342,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-megatag-issues/459879/4","custom_user_title":"WPILib Developer (Documentation), CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341819,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T14:19:23.822Z","cooked":"

Our odometry works well in Auto and even can get to mid-field notes much of the time. A little bit of teleop driving from say the Speaker to mid-field and the odometry is inaccurate. Passing by an AprilTag corrects it.

I wasn’t able to look in detail at the LL new ambiguity but the 0.9 value that was suggested looks to be very conservative. Almost never was it above 0.9.

We used to be a CTRE swerve drive train but couldn’t get more motor/motor controllers so we apparently are missing out on some CTRE features.

The impossibly fast robot I meant is the (apparently) ambiguity flipping.

Thanks for your comments. This and other threads give us plenty to consider for next year.

[I’m pretty happy with what the students could accomplish this year as our first year of AprilTags and PathPlanner and actual Command-Based. We don’t meet during the summer and very few hours during the fall (didn’t even make it through Basic Java lessons) but still managed to completely control our destiny and make Michigan state champs by week two with our first Blue Banner. I think paying close attention to what you and other experienced people have to say is what did it for us.]

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T14:19:23.822Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":68.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459879,"topic_slug":"limelight-megatag-issues","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":18342,"username":"jdaming","name":"Jason Daming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/limelight-megatag-issues/459879/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341935,"name":"Daniel","username":"1515_daniel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/1515_daniel/{size}/210147_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T18:04:31.845Z","cooked":"

Thank you very much for the advice, we will look into the library you provide. As far as your sources of error, the distance value would oscillate when we were stationary in front of the tag so we think it might be an issue with the limelight itself.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-24T18:04:31.845Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":69.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459879,"topic_slug":"limelight-megatag-issues","display_username":"Daniel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":18342,"username":"jdaming","name":"Jason Daming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63120,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limelight-megatag-issues/459879/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3341961,"name":"Jason Daming","username":"jdaming","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jdaming/{size}/137720_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-24T18:55:37.854Z","cooked":"

Was your camera at the same height as the target? LL says that they recommend for it not to be at the same height, I have found it to be more of a requirement and have gotten wild readings.

Was it one tag or 2? Does the same thing happen at an angle? One tag straight on is less ideal than at some angle even a little bit.
